But there is also http://t3.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcR3r9Bglf_pouV9Wt6g1RebdrwQjKqC8VkmcDpBFR1XwuTe_QL0vRnfYDc

So why not make it all http://t1.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQw5swLHvVsVuiurjFkIU7HGkDE2N0MZ0OwCE0RFaUSX4jvz62VhZGXb5BF

We are supposed to inhabit all the earth aren't we? (Genesis 1:28 for those who believe the truth).

Let's not bring the religious aspect into this. There are just some places we cannot live. There are not enough resources to support human life in some of these areas. It's too hot, not enough water, etc. Humans have a comfort zone, we can exist outside of this comfort zone as long as there is technology that brings it back down to the comfortable level (air conditioning, dehumidifiers etc.).

You know how there is http://t0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQpIqdnc5wo10R9Oej9bH1HyoZcezYKyo2FEy8KnYxfMQTN9MQ2D4phg-o

So why not make it all http://t1.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQw5swLHvVsVuiurjFkIU7HGkDE2N0MZ0OwCE0RFaUSX4jvz62VhZGXb5BF

We are supposed to inhabit all the earth aren't we? (Genesis 1:28 for those who believe the truth).

Eh, we already do inhabit all of the Earth. There's a population of humans on almost every significant landmass.
The purpose and meaning of this thread are not clear to me. Please remember that we would like to keep religious discussions off of our forum, if that is what this is about.
Overcrowding is a myth, it seems like there's a problem because people are unwilling to leave high density population areas.

I'm shutting this down guys.
